meanings.definition: To impose too heavy a tax on.
meanings.sent1: The government should not overtly tax its citizens.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided not to overtly tax the residents this year.
meanings.sent3: It would be comical if the mayor tried to overtly tax the pigeons in the park.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the tax burden was overtly taxing on the small business owners.
meanings.sent5: The idea of overtly taxing the air we breathe is absurd.

meanings.sent1: Carrying all those heavy books was overtly taxing on my back.
meanings.sent2: The long hours of work were overtly taxing on her mental health.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how a tiny ant can overtly tax a strong person trying to lift it.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise in the city can be overtly taxing on one's patience.
meanings.sent5: The emotional toll of the breakup was overtly taxing on his spirit.
